content.en: Consensus algorithms: Algorithms play a crucial role in solving the consensus problem, which involves reaching an agreement among multiple processes in a distributed system. These algorithms are designed to handle various failure scenarios, such as unreliable failure detection, crash failures, fail-stop and malicious processes, crash-recovery and message loss, and even Byzantine faults. They aim to ensure that consensus is achieved despite these challenges and determine the necessary conditions for reaching agreement. Additionally, algorithms explore different types of failure detectors, their capabilities, and their impact on solving consensus and other distributed problems.
content.da: Consensus-algoritmer: Algoritmer spiller en afgørende rolle i at løse konsensusproblemet, som indebærer at nå enighed blandt flere processer i et distribueret system. Disse algoritmer er designet til at håndtere forskellige fejlscenarier, såsom upålidelig fejldetektering, crash-fejl, fail-stop og ondsindede processer, crash-recovery og beskedtabe, og endda byzantinske fejl. De sigter mod at sikre, at der opnås konsensus til trods for disse udfordringer og fastlægger de nødvendige betingelser for at nå enighed. Derudover undersøger algoritmer forskellige typer af fejldetektorer, deres kapaciteter og deres påvirkning på løsningen af konsensus og andre distribuerede problemer.
